glsa.title: libebml: Heap buffer overflow vulnerability
glsa.synopsis: A heap-based buffer overflow in libeml might allow attackers to execute arbitrary code.

background.p: libebml is a C++ library to parse EBML files.

description.p: On 32bit builds of libebml, the length of a string is miscalculated, potentially leading to an exploitable heap overflow.

impact.p: An attacker able to provide arbitrary input to libebml could achieve arbitrary code execution.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: Users of libebml on 32 bit architectures should upgrade to the latest version:
